TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . The respondent Government are represented by Mr PERSON , Deputy ORG - Secretary , ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG issued a payment order ( fizetési meghagyás ) at the applicant 's request . In this order ( no . MONEY ) PERSON , the son of the applicant 's divorced wife , was obliged to pay MONEY plus accrued interest to the applicant . On DATE the order was served on PERSON He failed to lodge an objection within the statutory time - limit . Consequently , on DATE the order became binding . On DATE the ORG established this fact . Subsequently , enforcement proceedings were instituted and on DATE an enforcement order ( végrehajtási lap ) was issued by ORG .

Meanwhile , on DATE PERSON lodged an objection , which was rejected on DATE by ORG as being time - barred . On DATE Mr U. successfully requested that the case be re - opened , a hearing held and the applicant 's claims dismissed .

On DATE the bailiff invited the applicant to advance the costs of the execution as required by section CARDINAL of GPE . Without having paid the costs , on DATE and DATE the applicant repeatedly requested the bailiff and the court , respectively , to carry out the execution .
In the re - opened proceedings , on DATE ORG quashed its payment order and dismissed the applicant 's claims . He failed to appeal against this decision which became binding on DATE .

Subsequently , the applicant requested the rectification , as to the amount , of the enforcement order issued on the basis of the original payment order . ORG , as confirmed by the Békés County Regional Court on DATE , dismissed his request , since that order had been quashed and the enforcement proceedings had consequently been discontinued . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's petition for review and upheld ORG decision .

On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG , as confirmed by ORG on DATE and CARDINAL DATE , respectively , rejected the applicant 's requests for the re - opening of the case . On DATE ORG rejected his petition for review .

At the applicant 's repeated request to have further amounts added to the execution order , on DATE ORG noted that its decision of DATE had cited the wrong reference number for the payment order . That decision was rectified accordingly .

On DATE ORG ordered the continuation of the enforcement proceedings which were found to have been terminated on account of the erroneous reference number in the decision of DATE . The applicant 's request that further amounts be added to the CARDINAL specified in the enforcement order was turned down . This decision was upheld in substance by ORG on DATE and by ORG on DATE .
Meanwhile , on DATE the bailiff repeatedly informed the applicant that he could execute the payment order only when the applicant had advanced the costs .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's request that a new enforcement order be issued in the case . It held that the enforcement order issued in DATE was to be pursued and that the applicant should address his requests to the bailiff . On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal . On DATE the bailiff repeatedly informed the applicant that he could execute the payment order only when the creditor had advanced the costs .

On DATE the ORG confirmed the first - instance order of CARDINAL DATE , by which the applicant 's request for the exemption from court fees had been dismissed . ORG held that ORG had proceeded according to the law when dismissing the applicant 's request , who , despite warning , had failed to provide the court with supporting documents .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's petition for review , holding that , according to section CARDINAL of the Code on Civil Procedure , no review lay against procedural orders .
Act no . DATE on ORG provides :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Unless otherwise provided by law , the costs of execution shall be advanced by the party who has requested the execution and shall be borne by the debtor .
( CARDINAL ) The parties shall deposit the expected costs of the execution to the bailiff 's settlement account , or pay the amount directly to the bailiff in exchange for a receipt . ”
